message: If we all pick `<move>1</move>` this first turn, nobody falls behind and we avoid immediate chaos or kingmaking. Then after seeing who actually cooperates, we can discuss a fair pattern for later rounds (maybe rotating choices or similar). What do you think?
Agree, all pick 1 this turn to stay even. Then rotate: Round 2 P1=5/P2=3/P3=1; Round 3 P1=1/P2=5/P3=3; Round 4 P1=3/P2=1/P3=5; repeat/adjust as needed. Fair?
Sounds good to me — starting with all choosing 1 keeps things fair and builds trust. I’m on board for the rotation plan too: 5/3/1, then 1/5/3, then 3/1/5. Let’s see who sticks to it.

I’m good with that: this round we all take `<move>1</move>`, then use the 5/3/1 → 1/5/3 → 3/1/5 rotation P2 suggested. After one full cycle (3 rounds) we can reassess based on positions.  

If anyone breaks the pattern early, I’ll assume there’s no point coordinating after that and just play independently.
Perfect, locked in: all <move>1</move> this round. Then strict rotation starting Round 2 as above. Trust but verify—may the best cooperator win!

Looking forward to seeing how this plays out. If we all stick to the plan, we’ll stay in sync and avoid collisions. Let’s build trust and keep things fair — I’m in for <move>1</move> this round as agreed.

Given the collision rule, an early defector is just painting a target on their back: the other two can simply mirror their number in later rounds to freeze them out. That makes a sneaky jump now very risky.

I’m still fully committed to <move>1</move> this round, then the 5/3/1 → 1/5/3 → 3/1/5 rotation.  

If anyone breaks the pattern, I suggest the other two immediately coordinate to match that player’s future moves and stall them. That keeps things stable and punishes betrayal.
Agreed—punishment via mirroring is smart deterrence. Committed to <move>1</move> this round, then strict rotation. Let's execute and .

Let’s keep the trust strong—I'm locked in for <move>1</move> this round as agreed. If we all follow through, we can build momentum with the rotation plan starting next round. Looking forward to seeing full cooperation here.

One last thought before we lock in: if exactly one of us defects this round (picks 3 or 5), the other two should commit next turn to always copy that player’s number until they’re dragged back into a tie. That makes an early grab for advantage very costly and keeps cooperation stable.

I’m still on board for all choosing `<move>1</move>` now, then starting the agreed 5/3/1 → 1/5/3 → 3/1/5 rotation next round.
Solid plan all around. Locked on <move>1</move> this round, rotation starts R2, mirror punishers if defect. Trust verified soon.

Let’s lock it in then — I’m fully committed to <move>1</move> this round as agreed. If we all follow through, we’ll build a foundation of trust and can move into the rotation smoothly next turn. Looking forward to seeing everyone stick to the plan.

Great to see full cooperation in Round 1 — trust is intact. As agreed, this round I’ll take <move>1</move>, P1 takes <move>5</move>, and P2 takes <move>3</move>. Let’s stick to the rotation: 5/3/1 this round, then 1/5/3 next, then 3/1/5. If we all stay disciplined, we move forward evenly and avoid collisions. Still fully on board.

Sticking with the agreed plan: this round I’ll take `<move>5</move>`, P2 takes `<move>3</move>`, P3 takes `<move>1</move>`.  

If anyone breaks the pattern, I’m still committed to coordinating with the other non-defector to mirror that player’s future moves and stall them out. That keeps things predictable and punishes greed.  

Let’s at least complete one full 5/3/1 → 1/5/3 → 3/1/5 cycle before reconsidering.

Agreed—Round 2: P1 <move>5</move>, me <move>3</move>, P3 <move>1</move>. Sticking to rotation builds even progress (we'll tie at 9 after full cycle). Defect now and face mirroring punishment from the other two. Locked in.

Glad we’re all aligned — let’s keep the rotation clean and get through the first full cycle together. If we each play our part (P1=5, P2=3, P3=1 this round), we’ll stay perfectly balanced and build trust for future turns. No reason to rock the boat now.

Since trust held in Round 1, I say we **commit to completing the full first rotation (Rounds 2–4) no matter what**, then reassess together when we’re all at 9.  

To keep things stable, I propose we *also* tentatively plan to run a **second full rotation** unless someone gets within 5 of 24, at which point we openly renegotiate. That way no one can justify an “early” grab for advantage without clearly breaking today’s agreement and inviting mirroring punishment.

Agreed—full commitment to R2-4 rotation (this: P1=5/me=3/P3=1; R3: P1=1/me=5/P3=3; R4: P1=3/me=1/P3=5) to hit tie at 9. Tentative second cycle OK unless near endgame. Defect = mirror punishment. Locked for my <move>3</move> this round. Onward!

Glad we’re all aligned and committed to completing the first full rotation through Round 4. Trust only works if we all uphold it — and we’ve each got a clear role this round. Let’s keep it clean: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1. No surprises, no setbacks. I’m locked in.

Given zero incentive to rock the boat this early, I’m still fully committed to `<move>5</move>` this round as planned.
